Detailed Description

Encapsulates a derivative

Member Function Documentation

void Derivative::addEquivalentDerivative ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Derivative >  deriv  )  [private]

Add an equivalent derivative. No sanity checks are currently done. Because the equivalence check is complicated, this is currently private to prevent other objects from calling it.

int gigide::Derivative::index ( std::string   ) 

Sends back the coordinate number of a given letter index. See typelabel_. For example, the derivative

would have type label "ijkk" and index("k") would return 4.

Parameters:
The string in typelabel_
Returns:
The coordinate number associated with the letter

vector< int > Derivative::indices (  ) 

Returns a different representation of the derivative. For the derivative

The levels representation is <1 1 0 2>. The indices representation would be <1 2 4 4>

Returns:
The index representation of the derivative

string Derivative::polynomialString (  ) 

Builds a string representing the polynomial term associated with the derivative. For the example derivative

the string would be "x1x2(x4)^2"

double gigide::Derivative::taylorCoeff ( std::vector< double > &  disps  ) 

Computes the coefficient of the derivative in the Taylor expansion for a given set of displacements. For example, for the set of displacements <0.75,1.0,0,0.5> for the derivative

we would compute

The set of coordinates the derivatives are based on

The derivative type. See DerivativeType and typelabel_;

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<Derivative> > gigide::Derivative::equivderivs_ [private]

The vector of equivalent derivatives. The algorithm for determining equivalent derivatives can be rather complicated in cases of degenerate irreps. In simple cases, for example, you have

if and are equivalent coordinates.

boost::intrusive_ptr<Fit> gigide::Derivative::fit_ [private]

The fitting function for computing the derivative

std::map<std::string, int> gigide::Derivative::indices_ [private]

Stores a string map to describe the derivative. This is useful in recognizing derivatives as being equivalent. As an example, the derivative

would be the map
map["i"] = 1
map["j"] = 1
map["k"] = 2
to identify the derivative as having the structure

The following derivatve

would have the map
map["i"] = 1
map["j"] = 1
map["k"] = 1
map["l"] = 1

bool Derivative::initdone_ = false [static, private]

Standard init check

vector< string > Derivative::letters_ [static, private]

List of letters defining abstract derivative types. The vector is therefore <"i","j","k",l",...>. See typelabel_.

int gigide::Derivative::level_ [private]

The level of the derivative, i.e. 1st,2nd,3rd,etc...

std::vector<int> gigide::Derivative::levels_ [private]

The individual derivative levels for the coordinates in this derivative. For example, if you have the derivative

<1 1 0 2> to indicate the levels

boost::intrusive_ptr<Molecule> gigide::Derivative::mol_ [private]

The molecule the derivative is based on.

bool gigide::Derivative::nonzero_ [private]

Depending on symmetry to be determined later, the derivative might be rigorously zero

std::map<int,int> gigide::Derivative::nonzero_levels_ [private]

See levels_. Same vector with zeroes removed.

std::string gigide::Derivative::typelabel_ [private]

A string label representing the derivative. See indices_. For example, the derivative

would have typelabel "ijkk"

map< string, Derivative::DerivativeType > Derivative::typemap_ [static, private]

Maps typelabel_ to the appropriate enum DerivativeType

bool gigide::Derivative::unique_ [private]

Whether the derivative is unique, or if it is equivalent to another derivative and therefore does not need to be computed.

double gigide::Derivative::value_ [private]

The value of the derivative. This is assumed zero until assigned later by fit_.
